securitygame

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • CardPickup.Node

  • public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    Node class is used for creating nodes for the network. Important variables information for Attacker agents: nodeId - integer representing the node sv - security value of a node (-1 means unknown) pv - point value of a node (-1 means unknown) isHoneyPot - boolean for if the node is a honeypot (-1 means unknown, 0 means false, 1 means true) captured - if the node is a public entry node or has been successfully captured via attack bestRoll - the highest roll on this node (if -1, the node has never been attacked), if the security value is -1, bestRoll may be used to reason what the sv might be (actual security value >= bestRoll if sv == -1) neighborAmount - number of connections this node has. Will be different than neighbor.size() if the node has not been captured. (-1 means unknown) neighbor - list of neighbors to this node. Will be empty if the node has not been captured

      • isHoneyPot

        public boolean isHoneyPot()
        Sends the known honeypot status of this node. If the honeypot status is unknown (-1), false will be returned. knowsHoneyPot() should be used in conjunction with this method or use getHoneyPot() to find the specific status of a honeypot.
        Returns:
        if the node is a known honey pot, returns false if -1

      • getHoneyPot

        public int getHoneyPot()
        Returns the current status of a honey pot. -1 -> true honeypot status is unknown 0 -> this node is not a honeypot 1 -> this node is a honeypot
        Returns:
        honeypot's status

      • knowsHoneyPot

        public boolean knowsHoneyPot()
        Returns the knowledge of this node's honeypot status. If isHoneyPot is 0 or 1, this method returns true, because these values represent node status with certainty. If isHoneyPot is -1, this method returns false, because the true honeypot status of this node is unknown.
        Returns:
        the visibility of the honeypot status of this node

      • setHoneyPot

        public void setHoneyPot(boolean honeyPot)
        Sets the honeypot status of this node
        Parameters:
        honeyPot - sets the isHoneyPot to a known value (not -1)

      • setHoneyPot

        public void setHoneyPot(int honeyPot)
        Sets the honeypot status of this node -1 -> true honeypot status is unknown 0 -> this node is not a honeypot 1 -> this node is a honeypot
        Parameters:
        honeyPot - sets the isHoneyPot field variable
